column4: Cool,  I have been trying to get my wifi autoconnecting using ndiswrapper.  It was working but had to manually connect every time.  I tried a new version of ndiswrapper, and nothing worked so I reverted back to the original ndiswrapper (that is listed with ubuntu hardy) but now it does not work at all.  I am getting "FATAL: Module ndiswrapper not found." after entering "modprobe ndiswrapper".  Any ideas?
adding the module ie installing?
it already has an alias in etc/modprobe.d/ndiswrapper
ndiswrapper's module is provided by linux-ubuntu-modules-*. So i suggest you force reinstall this package if you've deleted ndiswrapper.ko by mistake.
I don't know how using synaptic, but with apt-get, it's apt-get install --reinstall packagename
have you rebooted after installing the new modules ?
still no go
what's the output of "ls /lib/modules/`uname -r`/ubuntu/misc/ndiswrapper/"
nope, that would be backticks ` and not ticks '
well, then you've reinstalled to wrong package :)
the package's name should be linux-ubuntu-modules-yourkernelversion.  So the reinstall command line is "sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-ubuntu-modules-`uname -r`"
yep
nope
the package's name should be linux-ubuntu-modules-yourkernelversion.  So the reinstall command line is "sudo apt-get install --reinstall linux-ubuntu-modules-`uname -r`"
IM?
you can tell here; are you lost ?
?? the command I gave you should have reinstalled the modules. You mean reboot, don't you ? If so -> yes
i'm discarding PMs
I am back up on wifi thank you very much.  Now I am back to trying to sort out the original problem with auto connecting
well, I would not know about that, I'm using kde and kde's network-manager autoconnects to known wifi access points.
yeah :)
